attributes.action: Lockdown to be lifted, allowing most restaurants,cafes, libraries,etc to re-open
attributes.additional_details: While some precautions should be made as the virus is still out there, the virus itself will never disappear and we cannot no longer ignore the fact that many people have lost their jobs, businesses and are currently unemployed and are barely surviving. Moreover, constantly sitting at home is not only horrible for your immune system, as minimal exposure to fresh air weakens your immune system and once you will be allowed to go out again, your body simple won’t be able to handle it.
attributes.background: A lot of people have lost jobs and they’re not getting anything from the government because they had zero hour contract, were self-employed,etc.People’s mental health is dramatically worsens as a lot of people are not able to stay inside for a long time because not everyone’s mental health allows it

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced easing of the lockdown restrictions, including allowing restaurants, cafes and libraries to open: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close-guidance

We have also published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

End lockdown to prevent further economic damage to the UK’s economy: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315979

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
